reference.Refstring: Huertas, C., & Juárez-Ramírez, R. (2012, September). NLARE, a natural language processing tool for automatic requirements evaluation. In Proceedings of the CUBE International Information Technology Conference (pp. 371-378).

descriptions.definition: "[...] [T]here are certain kind of words which are ambiguous by nature and this ones are being looked for ambiguity problems, this kind of words are foreign word"
"When t is a conjunction between two sets of words, it causes a lack of atomicity in a requirement."
descriptions.impact: "[non-atomic requirements] may produce partially verifiable requirements that should be avoided."

descriptions.definition: "It is important to delegate 'who' will execute the functionality expressed in the requirement. [...] An obvious expected element in a functional requirement is indeed a function to perform, which is translated to 'what'. [...] Additional detail to complete conditionals for requirement functionality, this can be seen as 'where' and/or 'when'."

datasets.description: Requirements Specification for a new hardware device for tracking vehicle position based on GPS signal with data download via WIFI (from an anonymous telemetry company)
